website_summaries.verdict: Though not a perfect router, the DIR-879 performs well and will fit most homes' needs and budget.
pros: The D-Link DIR-879 is fast, looks cool and at $140, is pretty affordable
cons: The web-based user interface lacks some customization features
You must manually update the router's firmware before it works as intended

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE IT RIGHT AWAY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was slow and laggy with connections issues at first, after the update to the newest firmware its PERFECT!!! blazing fast speeds all devices work flawlessly with no buffer issues or anything paired it with a surfboard and netgear range extenders. not one issue and my house is blanketed in flawless wifi. new firmware also got rid of the bright orange light and changed into a nice white glow
customer_reviews.author: RebuiltRiders

customer_reviews.title: Trust the bad reviews on the page
customer_reviews.text: Have had the router for about 10 months, It is constantly shutting down and disconnecting. I have the newest update and it doesn't make a difference. Wish i could get my money back. Trust the bad reviews on the page, i should of...
customer_reviews.author: jan prince

customer_reviews.title: Wifi disconnects during prolonged heavy use
customer_reviews.text: Disconnects users from wifi depending on how heavy the traffic is and the duration. Sometimes I can connect back to the router right away. Other times the router isn't connected to the internet even though modem is fine. Otherwise it works the other "99%" of the times. Latency is good in my opinion, let's just say I did not experience any lag. It's ok for casual use but definitely not recommended for heavy use because of wifi disconnects.
customer_reviews.author: Xiong Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Does the job perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed. After my modem went bad and my ISP replaced it, they were unable to get my WiFi working properly again. I had no idea what to do, but a technical friend found this router for me. I ordered it and he connected it to my ISP provided modem via ethernet cord and it works perfectly. Just like that, I have great WiFi throughout my home.
customer_reviews.author: Eleta K. Parris

customer_reviews.title: The new router D -Link AC1900 esthetically EXO is perfect and even color
customer_reviews.text: The new router D -Link AC1900 esthetically EXO is perfect and even color . The system configuration is very simple , anyone who does not know networking could make easily. It is fast , stable and strong connection , I have connected to the network two MacBook Pro three iPhone's , two iPad's and two Apple TV's and very solid and fast router behaves. The range of coverage is large and respectable . D -Link was right again so I remain consumers of its products from 14 years ago .
customer_reviews.author: Jose Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Decent power basic configuration
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a good router. Originally, I could not get more than 100M speed. Then I realized I was reusing the cable from my old router to connect to the modem. That was an old CAT5 cable that can never negotiate above 100M. When switching to the cable that came in the box, it worked properly. My only real complaint is that the configuration options are pretty lean.
customer_reviews.author: Randy R.

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: After reading multiple reviews, I decided to purchase this router. It works amazingly! I set it up to have both a 5Ghz and a 2.4Ghz point. Both are very fast and this thing is basically future-proof because of its high speed! Efficiently and consistently pushing 400mbps which is the max for the service I pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Fast router with awesome range
customer_reviews.text: Fast router that is great for most people today. Zero lag or speed issues for multiple live streams or gaming even when other devices are receiving stream. Excellent coverage is offered by the external anntennae. If you are thinking about purchasing one of these, don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: VuULF

customer_reviews.title: Good conversation piece.  Limited options.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot beat the price for an AC router with decent range. Lack of MU-MIMO is a detractor if you have a lot of devices, but you aren't going to find that at this price point anyway. Paired with gigabit internet, it handles throughput just fine over wired, and it doesn't leave my wireless devices starved. Good conversation piece. Limited options. But again, price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dole

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and somewhat unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: This router is ok but not very reliable. I have wireless IP cameras that were connected to this router but I added a second router for the cams since this router couldn't provide a reliable connection, the cams kept dropping offline and had to be reconfigured completely to reconnect. The cams have a rock solid connection to their new router so it wasn't the cams at fault
customer_reviews.author: Amazonoholic

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere due to buggy firmware.
customer_reviews.text: Good hardware but horrible firmware. Even with the lastest firmware dated 8/27/2017 has issues. The Guest WiFi does not work properly. The router reboot's for no reason. The quickVPN is not usable. Many function's in the firmware does not work. Returning unit.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher597

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Quality Wirelesss
customer_reviews.text: We're an ISP and use these for some of our residential end-users. The setup is essentially plug and play, unlike Netgear, which we always need to help our customers setup. We're able to run speedtests at 600+ Mbps over the wireless, so no complaints there either.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hacken

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: For the first time I decided not to just get the cheapest router I could find. Getting this one was a big mistake. The configurable options are very lacking. If you're a power user, this router just won't work for you. For example, it doesn't support static routes on the LAN. Even if you're not a power user, I have to restart the router regularly or it slows to a crawl. I've even stopped using the wireless on it altogether. I'll be replacing this router the second I get the time to do it.
customer_reviews.author: PKirby

customer_reviews.title: Great budget router, good range, decent speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Great router for the price. I am using it in access point only mode (extender mode per D-Link lingo) with my ISP's router. I get great signal around my house (1800sqft, 2 story) and my 2013 MacBook Pro consistently gets a 1Gbps wifi connection. Not my favorite styling, but its hidden in a cabinet. Setup was easy, took less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I personally like the aesthetics. It's rather large compared to some other routers, but not enough to be a problem. Vastly improved the WiFi reception throughout our home over the previous router it replaced. UI was intuitive and easy to use. I appreciated the drag and drop bandwidth priority system for connected devices as well. Minor complaint is that the on/off button is easy to hit when plugging/unplugging the nearby Ethernet connection, but this isn't a major concern by any stretch of the imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Alexander

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst routers I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit for my busy wifi household. Constantly slow, rarely worked correctly. So, I thought maybe it needs to be configured properly? No luck, updated software, ran it on basic settings etc. I would believe my own ignorance would be the root of my problems. I replaced it within six months and now have no problems and plenty of up time. Second Dlink router with issues. Last Dlink router for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Werner

customer_reviews.title: It out performs my old tp-link 1750
customer_reviews.text: Got this Router because my house got hit by lightning and had to replace it. This thing has incredible range compared to my tp link 1750 at least 2-3 times the range. I saw the bad reviews on this but took the chance on it and I am glade I did.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Easypeezy !
customer_reviews.text: extended my wireless range dramatically and easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: TROY WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a while
customer_reviews.text: The router itself worked fine for about 3 weeks then I noticed a loss of range , followed by an abrupt stoppage , no power or signal . I'm Currently waiting for a replacement .
customer_reviews.author: montes9R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router at an awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Automatically checks for and download new firmware. Great speed and coverage. Very stable so far. All this for less than $50. Can't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: ydooby

customer_reviews.title: Wide coverage, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I had the Netgear Nighthawk which worked well, but died in 4 months. This is a great replacement. I get Wi-Fi at every corner of the house where TP Link C9, Orbi, Linksys couldn't. The price is much better than Night hawk and interface and much more intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Tofu King Good

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Signal
customer_reviews.text: This router is awesome. It syncs both the 2.4 and 5ghz into one login and password. This gives you the ability to prioritize devices through the router's internal web page. It provides a strong enough signal to get through my whole house as well as most of my front and back yards. Totally impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Owens

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: When it works it works great... but it keeps losing connection, then re-connects, then loses connection. then re-connects. Annoying. I'd search for something else.
customer_reviews.author: J. Estrada

customer_reviews.title: First Rate WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and configure, and provides excellent network performance.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Works as advertised. Quality and worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Works as advertised. Quality and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: casiel

customer_reviews.title: Fast router
customer_reviews.text: Router is better comparing to my old D-link DIR-869. The only complaint is the power cord too short, I need to add another cord extension just to make everything work.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good range and good speed
customer_reviews.text: Have it up for 2 weeks now, so far very happy about it. It covers my house from one corner to other with excellent signal strength, in fact better signal than my FIOS quantum router.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent range, really fast download speed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent range, really fast download speed. Very stable signal. Have been using it for 3 months now, no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Rueda

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: The bad reviews on here I really don't understand. My house isn't huge, only 1600sqft but I've been using it for 2 weeks now and it's working flawlessly. I stream my TVs on DirecTV now and all of my devices are on wifi I would most definitely purchase this again and I would definitely recommend it to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan C

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to save $10 a month on our internet (Verizon charges you to rent theirs). Works great. 3400 square foot house, no dead zones
customer_reviews.author: KJinVA

customer_reviews.title: Device is easy to setup and configure. Service is very good!
customer_reviews.text: Works very good for me. Easy to set up and operate. I experienced a noticeable improvement in performance of my Internet service when compared to the previously used Router.
customer_reviews.author: L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Router died in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: After using for 6 months the router died. This is unacceptable. Don’t waste your time or money on it. Looks like I’ll be filing a claim with my credit card company.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, Reliable, great WIFI coverage with a great price tag. The orange is ugly, but I knew what I was Buying. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Killerpancake01

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up using their app on my phone. We use several things connected at once with no problem. The range is pretty good too compared to our other routers we tried.
customer_reviews.author: Ross1316

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works better than the standard modem you get from your ISP
customer_reviews.author: sunny vilaychit

customer_reviews.title: Nice router for the price!
customer_reviews.text: so far i have liked everything about this router, including the looks and the performance!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Branigan

customer_reviews.title: just plug it in to modem
customer_reviews.text: just plug into modem. has wifi name and password on bottom. good range.
customer_reviews.author: sylvia case

customer_reviews.title: Perfect so far.
customer_reviews.text: Only issues I have are when I turn on the 2.4ghz and 5ghz on my fios router. If Fios WiFi is disabled then it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Syllinx

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dropping connection...
customer_reviews.text: This router can't handle my 10+ device needs. I have updated the firmware, so not sure if that is an issue. I'm looking to replace this router soon. I have only own this for about 3 months and it has more downtime than my cheap Tenda AC1900 that I gave away. But then again....this router was cheap too. So you get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use! Just plug it in and the automated setup takes care of the rest!
customer_reviews.text: Mine has worked great so far with no issues! Its so affordable too!
customer_reviews.author: OC_

customer_reviews.title: DOA on receipt!
customer_reviews.text: Item came in like New but was DOA on receipt. Stuck in recovery mode. Sent back no problems
customer_reviews.author: Shaferkd

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Works like charm on my all-MAC computer network plus bunch of other Internet powered entertainment devises.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: D Link Router
customer_reviews.text: Great product it works very good.The best price of all other sellers.
customer_reviews.author: DOC720

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't work. It wouldn't even let me set it up. Tried everything, called dlink and received no help. DO NOT BUY! PIECE OF JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Horton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working fine in my 2 bedroom apartment. Easy to setup
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Sosa

customer_reviews.title: good wifi device for a townhouse, condo and no lags
customer_reviews.text: great product we have over 15 wifi devices, and it supports proper usage of them all. QOS operates very good including while im gaming online
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product especially for the money
customer_reviews.text: 1500sqft house, gigabit fiber running to the router, only about 6 devices connected at any time and it was dropping out every 20 minutes. Terrible product especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Speed and range
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to havea single blip with this router, Powerful and i get the speeds i was promised. super easy install
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Morales Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Does not power all my streaming devices
customer_reviews.text: Product does not power all my streaming devices. Constantly, rebooting router to see if working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful device, but once I clicked "update" it never ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful device, but once I clicked "update" it never worked the way it did out of the box. Went up and down intermittently and in the end it's a big paperweight for me right now.
customer_reviews.author: John Maeda

customer_reviews.title: I have my old Netgear WAP that I put back in its place and it works fine. I would like to return it with all ...
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second DIR 879 after the first one failed in only 2 months in service. The second one is now giving me the same issues as the first. I have my old Netgear WAP that I put back in its place and it works fine. I would like to return it with all the issues it is giving me, but it is past the return date. Whatever you do, don't buy a D-Link product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much improved signal from my N router, wireless extend mode is just a switch
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great. I am replacing an old WiFi N router that was working in extended mode to connect two separate portions of my house with WiFi. I almost didn't notice the wireless extender is a physical switch on the device itself. The signal levels are slightly better between the two AC bridged routers. Maybe it's because it has more antennae than my previous N router or maybe its because its on the less-used 5ghz. I went from getting a really spotty 5-10mbps between the networks to 30-50mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Diem

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable. Crashes often. Usually one of the radios suddenly stops working (either the 2.4GHz or the 5.0GHz) and sometimes both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo V

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: After spending 3 hours to both my internet provider and tech support at D-link the router was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Pedrazzi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router, great value
customer_reviews.text: Decent range, reliable connection. Be sure to apply latest firmware to patch KRACK vulnerability.
customer_reviews.author: axerik5

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: DOA. Router never finishes booting up. The orange light stays on solid. Tried to reflash the firmware, but it won't boot to recovery mode either.
customer_reviews.author: AYoungTech

customer_reviews.title: Great router.  Just update the firmware (which was easy).
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this one since I saw several bad reviews and I'm glad I did. I noticed that all of the 5 star reviews were saying that it worked great after firmware update. I ordered it, hooked up and went to the web address for the admin functions on the router. First thing that popped up was that there was an update for the firmware. I did it right off the bat then finished setting up the router and have had 0 problems what so ever. My old router was dropping connections and would buffer on videos. This one has been working great! I definitely recommend it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: great coverage, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my church. great coverage, easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Graham

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Whished it had an app to reboot. But other than that can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power and coverage. A bit simplified for the advanced configuration, but intuitive all around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great
customer_reviews.text: Had to return crapped out after three weeks.. when I setup it was awesome.. Customer support was below average.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth the price unless you really like the design and willing to use only 100 Mbps
customer_reviews.text: Looks great but won't you allow you to use the full speed of the en of only allows to use a tenth of that speed so if your internet is over 100 Mbps you only get 100 Mbps won't allow you to get anymore without dropping your internet
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: great router
customer_reviews.text: Good router not no Asus or mesh WiFi network but I pull down 175 mb and upload at 25 mbs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good choice.
customer_reviews.text: Did not install well. It doesn't handle a lot of streaming traffic well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work as advertised - or at all!
customer_reviews.text: I thought getting 5 GHZ and a more powerful router would help eliminate dead spots. The first one worked but didn't reach areas where the old router reached. It worked for about two weeks then just quit doing anything - the light was on but no router or wifi. I got the replacement and hooked it up. On this one wifi was very slow and connected slow or not at all to other devices. So this one is going back also. Based on my experience with this router I'd say this model has some serious issues. I don't know whether the issues are bad design or bad construction but this one is a loser!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Way faster than my previous router. Would be 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Way faster than my previous router. Would be 5 stars, but I occasionally have to restart it to get on of our computers to hook up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Suds

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, double the speed of what I was getting, I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great right out of the box. Easy to set up and works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Ted B.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COVERAGE AND FAST
customer_reviews.text: The only flaw I see on this router is you don't have the option to switch off the LED light but overall is an excelent option for those who are not computer geeks, very intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the interface setup. Other than that seems to work mechanically well.
customer_reviews.author: timothy payne

customer_reviews.title: If it could fly, it would crash into the side of the mountain.
customer_reviews.text: Had the looks, has no class. Don't even consider it. NETGEAR Nighthawk and you are finished shopping.
customer_reviews.author: NigelY75

product_meta.title: D-Link DIR-879 AC1900 EXO Wi-Fi Router
product_meta.description: The AC1900 Wi-Fi Router (DIR-879) comes with high power signal amplifiers that will deliver extreme Wi-Fi coverage to all your Wi-Fi devices. With wireless dual band speeds of 600Mbps and 1300Mbps, a dual core processor and SmartConnect technology, the DIR-879 avoids interference to deliver the fastest wireless speeds, improved coverage and reliable connections. The DIR-879 also comes with a new user interface so controlling your network is easier than ever. You can get online in minutes with the Quick Router Setup (QRS) app. The DIR-879 is a robust router solution that will give you a better signal throughout your home.
feature_bullets: High-power amplifiers (1000mW) - Wider coverage throughout your home
SmartConnect - Band steering automatically balances wireless devices among the two wireless bands
Smart Beam Forming - Dramatically enhances wireless signal strength and throughput
Dual Core Processor - Faster wireless speeds, improved coverage and reliable connections
Dual Band Wireless - Surf the internet on the 2.4GHz band while streaming HD on the 5GHz band
Built-in gigabit ports - Fast and reliable wired connections

specifications.Operating System: Windows 10, 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7 , or Mac OS X
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars205 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
